intro: Metastelma domingense, commonly known as the Dominican star vine, is a climbing plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Dominica. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
